description: This trap indicates the Sonet port's administrative status
has changed due to an operator-initiated command. Possible
admin status is EnabledInService, EnabledOutOfService
Disabled, and DryingUp.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetPortAdminStatusNotification IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusPortIndex i 9999 SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetAdminStatus i 3 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetPortAdminStatusNotification IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusPortIndex i 9999 SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetAdminStatus i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 4

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The shelf index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex

description: The slot index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex

description: The port index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusPortIndex

description: The administrative status of a Sonet port. EnabledInService
means the port configuration is applied and the port is
available to carry calls. EnabledOutOfService means the port
configuration is applied and the port is not available to carry
calls. Disabled means the port configuration is not applied
and the port is not available to carry calls. DryingUp means
the port is still carrying in-progress calls but is not available
for new calls. Value deleted is NO LONGER SUPPORTED.
variables.name: SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetAdminStatus

description: A description of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription

description: The category of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass

description: The severity level of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel

description: NO LONGER SUPPORTED. This trap indicates the Sonet
port's operational status
has changed.
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetPortOperStatusNotification IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusPortIndex i 9999 SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetOperStatus i 2 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 1

$SNMPTRAPCMD SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetPortOperStatusNotification IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusPortIndex i 9999 SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetOperStatus i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription s EXAMPLE SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass i 1 SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel i 4

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: The shelf index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusShelfIndex

description: The slot index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusSlotIndex

description: The port index of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusPortIndex

description: Operational status of the Sonet port. Port is inService
if the admin state is enabled and the admin mode is in
service. Port is outOfService if admin state is enabled
admin mode is out of service, and port is no longer
carrying calls (dried up). Port is dryingUp if admin
state is enabled, admin mode is out of service, and
port is drying up (no new calls, still carrying
in-progress calls). Port is inServiceDown if admin state
is enabled, admin mode is in service, but physical link
is not available due to alarm condition. Port is
outOfServiceDown if admin state is enabled, admin mode is
out of service, but physical link is not available due to
alarm condition. Port is disabled if admin state is
disabled, admin mode is out of service, and port is no
longer carrying calls (dried up).
variables.name: SONUS-SONET-MIB::sonusSonetOperStatus

description: A description of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventDescription

description: The category of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventClass

description: The severity level of the event that generated the trap.
variables.name: SONUS-COMMON-MIB::sonusEventLevel

description: This trap indicates the line Section/Line-layer alarm
state of the Sonet port has changed.

description: This trap indicates the Sonet port went out of service.

reasons include admin or hardware failure.
